title: NGO writes to CJI Sanjiv Khanna seeking probe against Allahabad high court judge over ‘anti-Muslim slurs' | Latest News India - Hindustan Times
selftext:
An NGO headed by senior Supreme Court lawyer Prashant Bhushan has written to Chief Justice of India (CJI) Sanjiv Khanna seeking a probe against Allahabad high court judge, Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav, who attended a meeting of the right-wing Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and made alleged anti-Muslim remarks at the event.

>The letter read, “Justice Yadav used unpardonable and unconscionable slurs against the Muslim community, bringing shame and disrepute to the High Office of a Judge of the Allahabad High Court and the Judiciary as a whole, besides undermining the rule of law he is meant to uphold.A strong institutional response is needed to restore public faith in the judiciary,” 
it added, and urged the CJI to immediately suspend the judicial work assigned to the high court judge and set up a time-bound, in-house committee to investigate him.
comments: Such incidents are becoming now norms in India. How many petitions we file? Do you even think SC going to give a heed? I doubt. We are really interested a great shiiiit.
Yes that judge needs to be sacked
allahabad high court seems to be like the mos corrupt and rotten court in india.
Allahabad high court not for beginners. Seriously!

The real criminal in this case was the judge. Judges like these are what allow such cases to happen in a systemic manner. The fact that nothing can be done to her, is what enables people like her to create a system wherein laws can be flouted, distorted and even weaponized just for some bribe.
Instructions unclear. So offered him an RS seat
PB name itself is enough for second thoughts.
